description: A variant of payphone permutations: given a circular booth with n payphones, one of which is already occupied, a(n) is the number ways for n-1 people to choose the payphones in order, where each person chooses an unoccupied payphone such that the closest occupied payphone is as distant as possible, and a payphone adjacent to a single occupied payphone is preferred over a payphone sandwiched between two occupied payphones.
